member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewDataControl.GetFiltersForDistictValues(System.String)
member.summary: Returns all currently applied filters WITHOUT the ones pertaining to the column with fieldName. This is used for the so called cascading filtering. For example, if you have filtered the grid by country and selected England when you go to the player name filtering drop down, you would like to see only english players in the distinct values list. However, when you go to the country filtering drop down you should not see only England, but all countries. So this method gathers all grid filters and removes the ones that are associated with fieldName -- in this case the FieldFilterDescription and the DistinctValuesFilterDescriptor.

member.summary: General notification for DependencyProperty changes from the grid or from columns.
member.remarks: This can be called from a variety of sources, such as from column objects or from this GridViewDataControl itself when there is a need to notify the rows and/or the cells in the GridViewDataControl about a property change. Down-stream handlers can check the source of the change using the "d" parameter.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewDataControl.GetDistinctValues(Telerik.Windows.Data.IDataFieldDescriptor,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the first 1000 distinct values for a given column.
member.param: A value indicating whether to filter the distinct values base on other columns' existing filters.
member.returns: An IEnumerable containing the distinct values.
member.remarks: The 'filter' parameter specifies whether distinct values should be filtered according to other columns' active filters. For example, if we have countries and players and we have filtered by CountryX, when we request all distinct players, if 'filter' is true we will get players from CountryX only. If 'filter' is false we will get all distinct players.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewDataControl.GetDistinctValues(Telerik.Windows.Data.IDataFieldDescriptor,System.Boolean,System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Returns distinct values for a given column.
member.param: A value indicating whether to filter the distinct values base on other columns' existing filters.
The maximum amount of distinct values to return. If you specify null for this parameter, then all distinct values will be returned.
member.returns: An IEnumerable containing the distinct values.
member.remarks: The 'filter' parameter specifies whether distinct values should be filtered according to other columns' active filters. For example, if we have countries and players and we have filtered by CountryX, when we request all distinct players, if 'filter' is true we will get players from CountryX only. If 'filter' is false we will get all distinct players.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewDataControl.ScrollIntoViewAsync(System.Object,System.Action{System.Windows.FrameworkElement},System.Action)
member.summary: Scrolls the row containing the data item into view in an asynchronous manner.
member.remarks: Since this method is asynchonous, calling it will return immediately. If you need to perform a certain action once the scrolling is done use the scrollFinishedCallback parameter to pass in a method to execute. The FrameworkElement parameter of this method will be the row that was just scrolled.
member.param: The data item to scroll into view.
The method to execute when scrolling has finished.
The method to execute when scrolling has failed.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewHeaderCell.HookupGripperEvents
member.summary:
Find grippers and register drag events
The default style for DataGridHeader is +-------------------------------+ +---------+ +---------+ + Gripper + Header + Gripper + + + + + +---------+ +---------+ +-------------------------------+
The reason we have two grippers is we can't extend the right gripper to straddle the line between two headers; the header to the right would render on top of it. We resize a column by grabbing the gripper to the right; the leftmost gripper thus adjusts the width of the column to its left.

member.summary: ClearViewModel gripper events.

member.summary: Begin generating at the given position and direction
member.remarks: This method must be called before calling GenerateNext. It returns an IDisposable object that tracks the lifetime of the generation loop. member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewItemContainerGenerator.DoLinearSearch(System.Windows.DependencyObject@,System.Object@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Performs a linear search.
member.remarks:
There's no avoiding a linear search, which leads to O(n^2) performance if someone calls ContainerFromItem or IndexFromContainer for every item. To mitigate this, we start each search at _startIndexForUIFromItem, and heuristically set this in various places to where we expect the next call to occur.
For example, after a successul search, we set it to the resulting index, hoping that the next call will query either the same item or the one after it. And after inserting a new item, we expect a query about the new item. Etc.
Saving this as an index instead of a (block, offset) pair, makes it more robust during insertions/deletions. If the index ends up being wrong, the worst that happens is a full search (as opposed to following a reference to a block that's no longer in use).
To re-use the search code for two methods, please read the description of the parameters.
member.param: If non-null, then searches for the container. Otherwise, updated with container for the item.
If non-null, then searches for the item. Otherwise, updated with the item that the container represents.
If a container or item is found, then updated with its index. Otherwise, set to -1.
member.returns: true if found, false otherwise.

member.summary: Return the UI element corresponding to the item at the given index within the ItemCollection.

member.summary: GridViewVirtualizingPanel implementation of .
member.remarks: The goal is to change offsets to bring the child into view, and return a rectangle in our space to make visible. The rectangle we return is in the physical dimension the input target rect transformed into our pace. In the logical dimension, it is our immediate child's rect.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewVirtualizingPanel.MeasureOverride(System.Windows.Size)
member.summary: General GridViewVirtualizingPanel layout behavior is to grow unbounded in the "stacking" direction (Size To Content). Children in this dimension are encouraged to be as large as they like. In the other dimension, GridViewVirtualizingPanel will assume the maximum size of its children.
member.remarks: When scrolling, GridViewVirtualizingPanel will not grow in layout size but effectively add the children on a z-plane which will probably be clipped by some parent (typically a ScrollContentPresenter) to Stack's size.
member.returns: Desired size.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewVirtualizingPanel.ArrangeOverride(System.Windows.Size)
member.summary: Provides the behavior for the Arrange pass of Silverlight layout. Classes can override this method to define their own Arrange pass behavior.
member.param: The final area within the parent that this object should use to arrange itself and its children.
member.returns: The actual size used once the element is arranged.

member.summary: Returns the extent in logical units in the stacking direction.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewVirtualizingPanel.ExtendDesiredSize(System.Int32,System.Windows.Size,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: DesiredSize is normally computed by summing up the size of all items we've generated. Pixel-based virtualization uses a 'full' desired size. This extends the given desired size beyond the visible items. It will extend it by the items before or after the set of generated items. The given pivotIndex is the index of either the first or last item generated.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewVirtualizingPanel.ContainerSizeForItem(System.Int32,System.Windows.UIElement@)
member.summary: Returns the size of the container for a given item. The size can come from the container, a lookup, or a guess depending on the virtualization state of the item.
member.param: Returns the container for the item; null if the container wasn't found.

member.summary: Inserts a new container in the visual tree.

member.summary: Inserts a recycled container in the visual tree.

member.summary: Inserts a container into the Children collection. The container is either new or recycled.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewVirtualizingPanel.AddContainerFromGenerator(System.Int32,System.Windows.UIElement,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Takes a container returned from Generator.GenerateNext() and places it in the visual tree if necessary. Takes into account whether the container is new, recycled, or already realized.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewVirtualizingPanel.CleanupContainers(System.Int32,Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.BaseItemsControl)
member.summary: Immediately cleans up any containers that have gone offscreen. Called by MeasureOverride. When recycling this runs before generating and measuring children; otherwise it runs after.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewVirtualizingPanel.ChildIndexFromRealizedIndex(System.Int32)
member.summary: Takes an index from the realized list and returns the corresponding index in the Children collection.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewVirtualizingPanel.DisconnectRecycledContainers
member.summary: Recycled containers still in the Children collection at the end of Measure should be disconnected from the visual tree. Otherwise they're still visible to things like Arrange, keyboard navigation, etc.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewVirtualizingPanel.AdjustFirstVisibleChildIndex(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Called after 'count' items were removed or recycled from the Generator. _firstVisibleChildIndex is the index of the first visible container. This index isn't exactly the child position in the UIElement collection; it's actually the index of the realized container inside the generator. Since we've just removed some realized containers from the generator (by calling Remove or Recycle), we have to adjust the first visible child index.
member.param: Index of the first removed item.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewVirtualizingPanel.AdjustViewportOffset(Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.MeasureData,Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewVirtualizingPanel.IProvideStackingSize,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the MeasureData we'll be using for computations in MeasureOverride. This updates the viewport offset based on the one set in the MeasureData property prior to the call to MeasureOverride.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewVirtualizingPanel.SetVirtualizationState(Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.BaseItemsControl,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Sets up IsVirtualizing, VirtualizationMode, and IsPixelBased
IsVirtualizing is true if turned on via the items control and if the panel has a viewport. VSP has a viewport if it's either the scrolling panel or it was given MeasureData.
VSP can only make use of, create, and propagate down MeasureData if it is pixel-based, since the viewport is in pixels.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewVirtualizingPanel.FocusChanged
member.summary: Called when the focused item has changed. Used to set a special DP on the next and previous focusable items. Only used when virtualizing in a hieararchy (i.e. BaseItemsControl virtualization).

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewVirtualizingPanel.ScrollData
member.summary: Helper class to hold scrolling data.
member.remarks: This class exists to reduce working set when GridViewVirtualizingPanel is used outside a scrolling situation. Standard "extra pointer always for less data sometimes" cache savings model: !Scroll [1xReference] Scroll [1xReference] + [6xDouble + 1xReference]

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ScrollData class.

member.summary: Clears layout generated data. Does not clear scrollOwner, because unless resetting due to a scrollOwner change, we won't get reattached.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewVirtualizingPanel.ScrollData.Offset
member.summary: Gets or sets the Scroll offset of content. Positive corresponds to a visually upward offset. Set by methods like LineUp, PageDown, etc.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewVirtualizingPanel.ScrollData.ComputedOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the computed offset based on _offset set by the IScrollInfo methods. Set at the end of a successful Measure pass. This is the offset used by Arrange and exposed externally. Thus an offset set by PageDown via IScrollInfo isn't reflected publicly (e.g. via the VerticalOffset property) until a Measure pass.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.KeyboardNavigationMode
member.summary: Specifies the possible values for changes in focus when logical and directional navigation occurs.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.KeyboardNavigationMode.Continue
member.summary: Each element receives keyboard focus, as long as it is a navigation stop. Navigation leaves the containing element when an edge is reached.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.KeyboardNavigationMode.Once
member.summary: The container and all of its child elements as a whole receive focus only once. Either the first tree child or the or the last focused element in the group receives focus.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.KeyboardNavigationMode.Cycle
member.summary: Depending on the direction of the navigation, the focus returns to the first or the last item when the end or the beginning of the container is reached. Focus cannot leave the container using logical navigation.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.KeyboardNavigationMode.None
member.summary: No keyboard navigation is allowed inside this container.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.KeyboardNavigationMode.Contained
member.summary: Depending on the direction of the navigation, focus returns to the first or the last item when the end or the beginning of the container is reached, but does not move past the beginning or end of the container.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.KeyboardNavigationMode.Local
member.summary: Tab Indexes are considered on local subtree only inside this container and behave like Continue after that.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewRowItem.SyncProperties(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Fired when the Row is attached to the GridViewDataControl. The scenario here is if the user is scrolling and the Row is a recycled container that was just added back to the visual tree. Properties that rely on a value from the Grid should be reevaluated because they may be stale.
member.remarks:
Properties can obviously be stale if the GridViewDataControl's value changes while the row is disconnected. They can also be stale for unobvious reasons.
For example, the Style property is invalidated when we detect a new Visual parent. This happens for elements in the row (such as the RowHeader) before Prepare is called on the Row. The coercion callback will thus be unable to find the GridViewDataControl and will return the wrong value.
There is a potential for perf work here. If we know a DP isn't invalidated when the visual tree is reconnected and we know that the Grid hasn't modified that property then its value is likely fine. We could also cache whether or not the Grid's property is the one that's winning. If not, no need to redo the coercion. This notification is pretty fast already and thus not worth the work for now.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewRowItem.ClearRow(Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewDataControl)
member.summary: Clears the row of references.
